p: Idoxuridine and trifluridine are structurally similar thymidine analogues that inhibit synthesis of DNA. They have been applied in the treatment of feline herpesvirus-1 (FHV-1), significantly reducing the number of viral plaques in vitro (Nasisse et al. 1989). Idoxuridine has also exhibited therapeutic potential against equine herpesvirus type 2 (EHV-2) by alleviating the ocular symptoms caused by the infection (Collinson et al. 1994). It has also been reported that idoxuridine in the concentration of 0.1% and 0.3% trifluridine can limit the viral replication but do not kill the virus (Plummer et al. 2014).
